availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Glore (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, Master Tobacconist.)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, master tobacconist. Kentucky native. Son of Simeon Glore. Married to Harriet Glore. Father of John Glore, William Glore, Charles Glore, Robert Glore, and Harry Glore. Married to Mary Lemore Glore in Covington on October 19, 1858. Tobacconist in Covington in 1850. Master tobacconist in Covington in 1860. Tobacconist in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 274A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 190.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994043, Kenton County Marriages.
"William H. Glore(1818-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #132060785, accessed July 5, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132060785.
